title: Although this chapter has focused almost exclusively upon the spiritual endowment of Neoplatonism, much could also be said regarding its philosophical and literary contributions to Western culture. For example, Spinoza, Leibniz, Schelling, Hegel, and Bergson were each, in various ways, influenced by Neoplatonism. The same is true for poets such as Blake, Coleridge, Shelley, and Yeats
